definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
to rave/to babble in one's sleep

sentences.english: Ay, I don't talk behind a nigga back, I say it in his face.
sentences.chinese: 诶，我不会在人背后说三道四，我会当着他的面说。

sentences.english: Vice Snr-Gen Maung is a real soldier and a battle-oriented person.
sentences.chinese: 孟诶副大将是一个真正的军人，以战场为生。

sentences.english: Whenever Vice Snr-Gen Maung Aye wants to see Snr-Gen Than Shwe, he needs permission first.
sentences.chinese: 每当孟诶副大将希望会见丹瑞大将，他需要许可。

sentences.english: Well, Mr. Tucker, while that sets up…
sentences.chinese: 诶，唐克先生，您那固定还要一会。

sentences.english: Back at MIT,Li Huei Tsai had also discovered something new.
sentences.chinese: 回到麻省理工学院，黎乎诶仔也发现了一些新的东西。

sentences.english: Uh, you gave me an exacta.
sentences.chinese: 可你给我的是正序连赢诶。

sentences.english: Look! There's a basketball game on. Your dad would've liked to watch that.
sentences.chinese: 篮球赛诶，你爸会想要看的。

sentences.english: But, if you’re a developer, oh boy, would I be unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你是个开发者，诶，哥们儿，我真替你难过。

sentences.english: DiMartino: I don’t want to give anything away, but rest assured there’s a definite link between the old series and this one.
sentences.chinese: 我不想剧透诶，不过新老剧之间肯定有一定联系的。

sentences.english: On the streets of Beijing, we conducted our own informal survey.
sentences.chinese: 在诶经的街头，我们也进行了一场非正式的调查。

sentences.english: Well, I’d say diplomacy has failed.
sentences.chinese: 诶呀呀，看来我们的外交努力失败了。

sentences.english: Bones: Don’t be nice to me after I got you in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 别对我这么好，我给你惹了一身的麻烦诶。

definition: interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
auxiliary showing sth happened in the past
